channel.title: What do you think of this laptop?
channel.description:
I'd be using it for gaming and school work, Do you think I should go for it?
[img]http://images.icecat.biz/img/norm/low/1665437-1700.jpg[/img] [img]http://xtreview.com/images/LG%20R410%20and%20R510.jpg[/img]
------------------ System Information ------------------ Operating System: Windows Vista™ Home Premium System Manufacturer: LG Electronics System Model: R510 Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU T9400 @ 2.53GHz (2 CPUs), ~2.5GHz Memory: 3068MB RAM (this is actually 4gb, but 1gb of it is dedicated to graphics) Page File: 1412MB used, 4925MB available DirectX Version: DirectX 10 --------------- Display Devices --------------- Card name: NVIDIA GeForce 9600M GS Manufacturer: NVIDIA Chip type: GeForce 9600M GS Display Memory: 1778 MB Dedicated Memory: 499 MB Shared Memory: 1278 MB Current Mode: 1280 x 800 (32 bit) (60Hz) Monitor: Generic PnP Monitor
The 9600 is what I really liked about it, most decent card I could find on a laptop here.
At 1,361.62 USD (its actually a bit more than that) is this laptop worth it?

item.title: What do you think of this laptop?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:12, topic:283323”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=374400.msg2824003#msg2824003 date=1244841400]

Gaming on a laptop = stupid.
Buying anything but a Lenovo = stupid.

I like how the specs you posted did not include RAM type, RAM frequency, or any real specifications on the video card or its bus.

Lenovos are like the worst possible computer you can buy.

Good hardware support, generic casing, durable. Hmmm, sounds like shit to me.
[/quote]
Only bad thing about them is that they are fucking ugly, except this one.[/quote]
Imo hardware > looks.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of this laptop?

item.title: What do you think of this laptop?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

It’s not so easy here in the uae. It’s hard to get around to building my own rig and I can’t exactly order it all off newegg. I’m buying a laptop for now and aim to build a desktop once I go back to Australia. Here’s some more info on the specs:

DDR2 (800MHz, Up to 4GB)
NVIDIA® GeForce® 9600M GS (DDR2 512MB VRAM, *TurboCache Support)

Couldn’t find any other information though. The Video card comes with 512mb dedicated and for my friend’s laptop, it seems that it came with 1gb extra memory dedicated from the ram. I don’t know why :p… I have yet to see a lenevo here (without it being a ‘netbook’)

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of this laptop?

item.title: What do you think of this laptop?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

MujaheD:

Processor: Intel® Core™2 Duo CPU T9400 @ 2.53GHz (2 CPUs), ~2.5GHz

~2.5GHz… rifk
I don’t understand why you need 1.7GB of video memory? Crysis doesn’t even need that much!

Its a serious rip-off, If you want to game you can easily get a desktop for around $600 and be happy.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of this laptop?

item.title: What do you think of this laptop?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

sanga282:

be careful when buying alaptop for school work that is also used for gaming, i did and mine is a little heavy to lug around all day i’d keep them seperate if i were you. Get a netbook for school and a gaming desktop for home

From what I know, this laptop is pretty light. But your right, it’s only temporary for gaming as I plan to build a desktop in about a year or so.

Read full topic

item.title: What do you think of this laptop?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I’d be using it for gaming and school work, Do you think I should go for it?

System Information

Operating System: Windows Vista™ Home Premium
System Manufacturer: LG Electronics
System Model: R510
Processor: Intel® Core™2 Duo CPU T9400 @ 2.53GHz (2 CPUs), ~2.5GHz
Memory: 3068MB RAM (this is actually 4gb, but 1gb of it is dedicated to graphics)
Page File: 1412MB used, 4925MB available
DirectX Version: DirectX 10

Display Devices

    Card name: NVIDIA GeForce 9600M GS   
 Manufacturer: NVIDIA
    Chip type: GeForce 9600M GS

Display Memory: 1778 MB
Dedicated Memory: 499 MB
Shared Memory: 1278 MB
Current Mode: 1280 x 800 (32 bit) (60Hz)
Monitor: Generic PnP Monitor

The 9600 is what I really liked about it, most decent card I could find on a laptop here.

At 1,361.62 USD (its actually a bit more than that) is this laptop worth it?
